body.p:
Cincinnati Feby 20 1861
Hon. Robt Richardson
Covington Ky

Dr Sir: I should like to be appointed a Commissioner for Kentucky for this state, I am not personally acquainted with Gov. McGoffin. Will you add another to the list of favors you have done me, by procuring this appointment for me.
For the present I have a desk in F. D. Lincoln's office 8 Columbia St. where I shall be glad to see you whenever you are in Town.

Very Truly Yours &c
Wm P. Mellen

I am personally acquainted with Wm P. Mellen Esq. of Cincinnati O. and recommend him to Gov. Magoffin as a person morally and professionally well qualified to discharge the duties of a Commissioner of deeds of this State

Ohio
Comr. of Deeds
Wm P. Bellen
Cin
Issd Feby 27 1861
